message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.CT, cs.CL, cs.LF

Reasoning: The paper deals with categorical descriptions of substitution systems, which are related to logic and programming languages. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science). Additionally, the paper mentions the organization of substitution systems into a category, which is related to category theory, and thus cs.CT (Category Theory) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also deals with syntax involving binding, which is related to programming languages, and thus cs.PL (Programming Languages) and cs.CL (Computation and Language) are also possible sub-categories. Finally, the paper mentions UniMath, which is a library of univalent mathematics, and thus cs.LF (Logic and Foundations of Mathematics) is also a possible sub-category.
